metadata.titleEn: Synchronous observation data set of soil temperature and soil moisture in the upstream of Luan River (2018)
metadata.description:
This data set contains the surface temperature, soil temperature, and soil moisture data measured simultaneously during the Soil Moisture Experiment in the Luan River (SMELR) in 2018, which is used as "true value" to validate the remote sensing retrieval. The dataset includes soil moisture (volumetric water content, %) of the surface layer (0-5cm), soil moisture of the deeper layers (5, 10, 20, 40 cm), temperature (℃) of shaded soil, illuminated soil, 5-cm soil, shaded and illuminated vegetation.
The ground synchronous sampling quadrats were distributed in the upstream of Luan River (Shandian River Watershed and Xiaoluan River Watershed), and the sampling time was September in 2018. ML3 soil moisture sensor, TR-52i temperature sensor, soil ring sampler were used for measurement. The sampling scheme of Large Quadrat--Small Quadrat--Sampling Location was adopted to obtain data.
metadata.instructions:
File name: The soil moisture data file is: AirborneEx_Soil_Moisture.xls;The soil temperature data file is: AirborneEx_Soil_Temperature.xls;The soil moisture at deeper layers data file is: AirborneEx_Soil_Moisture_Deeper_Layers.xls
File content: each file contains 8 sheets, and sheet name is the observation date of the data, such as "20180916 (yyyymmdd)". The data filling value is - 999.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific attributes and features measured when collecting data on soil moisture and temperature in the context of remote sensing experiments?
Feature Specification.Answer: soil moisture at the surface level (0-5 cm), soil moisture at various depths (5, 10, 20, 40 cm), surface soil temperature, soil temperature under light, soil temperature under shade, vegetation temperature under light, vegetation temperature under shade

Definition.Question: What does the term '地面同步测量' mean in the context of soil temperature and moisture data collection?
Definition.Answer: '地面同步测量' refers to the method of collecting soil temperature and moisture data simultaneously with remote sensing activities to provide 'ground truth' values. This involves measuring surface and subsurface soil moisture, as well as soil temperature under sunlight and shadow, using tools like portable soil moisture meters and external probe-type temperature recorders. The sampling follows a nested scheme of sample area-sample plot-sample point distribution.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the accuracy of soil temperature and moisture measurements in the context of ground-based synchronized observations?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Factors contributing to the accuracy of soil temperature and moisture measurements include the use of portable soil moisture meters, external probe-type temperature recorders, and the ring knife method. Additionally, the nested sampling scheme of sample area-sample plot-sample point and the timing of the sampling in September 2018 play a role in ensuring accurate data collection.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to collect surface and soil temperature and moisture data in the upstream area of the Luan River using synchronized ground observations?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal is to provide 'ground truth' data for validating remote sensing retrievals during the soil moisture remote sensing experiment, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of remote sensing data by comparing it with direct, on-site measurements.
